headline: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
description: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

headline: Bad Bunny brings Puerto Rico's culture to Super Bowl halftime show, with a Lady Gaga surprise
AI's impact on entire sectors of the economy shakes Wall Street
Portugal: Socialist Antonio José Seguro elected president, beating far right
description: His opponent, André Ventura, founder and leader of the far-right Chega party, garnered more votes than in the May 2025 parliamentary elections, and has established himself as a key figure in the country's political scene.

headline: French police arrest six over cryptocurrency magistrate kidnapping
description: The suspects were taken into custody following the discovery of the 35-year-old magistrate and her 67-year-old mother on Friday morning, found injured in a garage in the southeastern Drôme region.

headline: 'The ancient city-states Thucydides describes resemble the middle powers of the 21st century'
description: Today's middle powers are reshaping their alliances to confront Donald Trump's United States, much as the Sicilian city-states did against imperialist Athens in the 5th century BCE, historian Robert Zaretsky argues.

headline: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
description: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

headline: Hong Kong sentences pro-democracy mogul Jimmy Lai to 20 years in jail
Israel announces measures to deepen control over West Bank
French cosmetics sales drop in the US after being struck by tariffs
UK PM Starmer's chief of staff resigns over Epstein-linked ex-ambassador Mandelson's appointment
Japan's ruling party on track for an overwhelming majority in snap legislative elections
At Centre Pompidou-Metz, the late resurrection of sculptor Louise Nevelson
Richard Reeves, the researcher studying the suffering of the modern man
Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
The bride wore Birkenstocks
How climate change is transforming avalanches
Thailand's conservative prime minister defies expectations to win general election
2026 Super Bowl: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
description: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

headline: Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
description: Millions of emails released by the US Department of Justice reveal the financier's relationships, some more intense than others, with several figures from France's politics and culture.

headline: 2026 Winter Olympics: Artificial snow takes a toll on the environment
description: The Milan Cortina Olympic Games are no exception: Artificial snowmaking will be used almost everywhere. This technology, which requires large amounts of water and energy, has led to major infrastructure changes that have been criticized by environmental advocates and scientists.

headline: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
'We, journalists of Agence France-Presse, believe management's plan would lead to our complete demise'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
